qas.question: What company has the right to all recordings from contestants on American Idol?
What company took over as American Idols music label in 2010?
What company had released music from American Idol in addition to Sony Music Entertainment?
Who owns the rights to all phonographic material done by the contestants?
Who did 19 initially partner with to distribute the recordings?
Who did BMG partner with in 2005-2007?
Who replaced Sony in 2010 as Idol's music label?

context: <a0_0><a4_0>19 Recordings<a4_0/><a0_0/>, a recording label owned by <a3_0>19 Entertainment<a3_0/>, currently hold the rights to phonographic material recorded by all the contestants. 19 originally partnered with Bertelsmann Music Group (<a2_0><a5_0>BMG<a5_0/><a2_0/>) to promote and distribute the recordings through its labels RCA Records, Arista Records, J Records, Jive Records. In 2005-2007, BMG partnered with <a6_0>Sony Music Entertainment<a6_0/> to form a joint venture known as Sony BMG Music Entertainment. From 2008-2010, Sony Music handled the distribution following their acquisition of BMG. Sony Music was partnered with American Idol and distribute its music, and In 2010, Sony was replaced by as the music label for American Idol by <a1_0><a7_0>UMG<a1_0/>'s Interscope-Geffen-A&M Records<a7_0/>.
